pullRequest.title: Identifiable.name is optional + introduce getOptionalName(), getNameOrId() + deprecate getName()
pullRequest.bodyText:
Signed-off-by: RALAMBOTIANA MIORA miora.ralambotiana@rte-france.com
Please check if the PR fulfills these requirements (please use '[x]' to check the checkboxes, or submit the PR and then click the checkboxes)

 The commit message follows our guidelines
 Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
 Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

Does this PR already have an issue describing the problem ?
fix #178
Does this PR introduce a breaking change or deprecate an API? If yes, check the following:

 The Breaking Change or Deprecated label has been added
 The migration guide has been updated in the github wiki (What changes might users need to make in their application due to this PR?)

Other information:
The lack of coverage is not really linked to this PR, but to the code corrected by this PR... Should the tests be added here (bearing in mind, this is not easily tested)? @mathbagu

commit.message:
Identifiable.name is optional + introduce getOptionalName(), getNameOrId() + delete getName()

Signed-off-by: RALAMBOTIANA MIORA <miora.ralambotiana@rte-france.com>

correction after rebase

Signed-off-by: RALAMBOTIANA MIORA <miora.ralambotiana@rte-france.com>

nodes.bodyText:
I think we should make getName deprecated to avoid a breaking change.
Then in a later release we could remove this getName, make getOptionalName deprecated and recreate a getName that behaves like getOptionalName. What do you think?
same remark here and in all other concerned files below

commit.message:
Keep getName() as deprecated

Signed-off-by: RALAMBOTIANA MIORA <miora.ralambotiana@rte-france.com>
